comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 3 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 3 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 3 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: nytimes.com hiding "Subscribe"
issue.body:
### Prerequisites - [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml); - [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [x] Browser version is up-to-date; - [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? Other ad blocker ### AdGuard version Title: AdGuard Annoyances filter, Version: 2.2.51.34 ### What type of problem have you encountered? Website or app doesn't work properly ### Which browser(s) do you use? other (specify in comment below) ### Which device do you use? Desktop ### Where is the problem encountered? https://www.nytimes.com/2025/12/08/world/americas/mexico-russia-spies.html ### Ad Blocking AdGuard Base filter ### Privacy _No response_ ### Social Widgets _No response_ ### Annoyances _No response_ ### Security _No response_ ### Other _No response_ ### DNS filters _No response_ ### Language-specific _No response_ ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. The filter: `nytimes.com##.StoryBodyCompanionColumn > div[class^="css-"] > p[class^="css-"]:has(> a[href^="https://www.nytimes.com/subscription"])` will hide a line saying: `[Subscribe to The Times](https://www.nytimes.com/subscription?campaignId=8WXW7) to read as many articles as you like.` Which might seem a good thing. But, the line is only visible if user is not a paying reader and is using a method of half-disabling a soft-wall. Meaning they just hide overlying dialogs and enable page scrolling. But the line (or something there) is important, as it's a sign that the article is not complete. And from experience, this happens a lot. Readers just think the article is short and they see it wholly. To make it more obvious for them, I even added another, more obvious line saying the article is not complete. Furthermore for my case, when an AD blocker hides this line, my Note is hidden with it, but I'd just move it to a previous sibling if you'd decide to keep the filter. Please consider removing this filter, or adding a similar note. the note: ``` .meteredContent > div:last-of-type p:last-of-type:has(a[href^="https://www.nytimes.com/subscription"])::before { content: "The rest of the article is visible to paying subscribers only."; display: block; /* text-align: center; */ color: #666; font-size: 18px; font-family: nyt-franklin, helvetica, arial, sans-serif; line-height: 1rem; border-top: thin solid red; border-bottom: thin solid red; background: black; padding-bottom: 2px; } ``` 2. Screenshots
Screenshot 1: when half-disabling soft wall
Screenshot 2: with a note
Screenshot 3: what a user sees now with Adguard filter
Screenshot 4: for paying visitor the article continues
### Privacy - [x] I agree to follow this condition

Please consider removing this filter, or adding a similar note. the note: ``` .meteredContent > div:last-of-type p:last-of-type:has(a[href^="https://www.nytimes.com/subscription"])::before { content: "The rest of the article is visible to paying subscribers only."; display: block; /* text-align: center; */ color: #666; font-size: 18px; font-family: nyt-franklin, helvetica, arial, sans-serif; line-height: 1rem; border-top: thin solid red; border-bottom: thin solid red; background: black; padding-bottom: 2px; } ``` 2. Screenshots
Screenshot 1: when half-disabling soft wall
Screenshot 2: with a note
Screenshot 3: what a user sees now with Adguard filter
Screenshot 4: for paying visitor the article continues
### Privacy - [x] I agree to follow this condition
